author: JDragon1
body:
This sort of proves my point on incompetence. WebEx from Citrix is pretty easy to use, but if people do not care about security, guess Zoom is here to stay.

Like when Equifax exposed millions of people, but banks and credit unions are still reporting to Equifax. Guess people stopped caring.

author: MustWarn0thers
body: I tried to play Citrix calls that I was super confident in, they smashed earnings and tanked. My asshole is still chapped and I hope you kick some fucking ass in honor of mine.

author: Bluemoonclay
body: Lol thanks. Hoping for just a runup to earnings and can unload half .. don't really like holding through earnings. This shit happens too often like you had with Citrix

author: ShruteFarms23
body: This is logical, no pun intended, but I got fucked on CTXS earnings and they provide similar services and beat earnings

author: Ankel88
body: I got fucked too on Ctxs but you have clearly no idea about what Citrix does

author: greycap7
body: thoughts on ctxs? i can imagine everyone has upped their subs?

author: carlos5577
body: vmware, juniper, maybe cisco, citrix. Until people stop buying tech I guess

author: MustWarn0thers
body: CTXS is like the most autistic stock. It's climbed 24 percent the last 3 months, it crushed earnings and dove down to the earth's core, the markets show volatility and it climbs.

author: JDragon1
body: I ended up buying shares of both Citrix and CSOD, and a small position of 10 calls of CSOD on Friday. Cashed out on the calls during lunch today. Just holding shares. Worked out so far.

author: JDragon1
body:
This sort of proves my point on incompetence. WebEx from Citrix is pretty easy to use, but if people do not care about security, guess Zoom is here to stay.

author: JDragon1
body: I ended up buying shares of both Citrix and CSOD, and a small position of 10 calls of CSOD on Friday. Cashed out on the calls during lunch today. Just holding shares. Worked out so far.

author: DrMancini
body: Companies like google and Facebook stifle innovation by buying out smaller companies that threaten their moat. That’s why end up with taxi services (uber/Lyft) and hotels (air b&b) with a twist. Alphabet is just a giant online IPG minus the creativity.
